result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Glen S. Stanford was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Glen S. Stanford was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on August 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

(14CF97 and 14CF122) Defendant Glen S. Stanford in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Mayer heard regarding Defendant entering pleas today.  State files Amended Information.  Atty. Mayer has no objection to amended information.  Atty. Mayer withdraws any motions to be heard today.  PAC .156%  Repeater enhancer in each case is dismissed.  Court reviews charges, penalties and rights.  Court reviews PQWOR.  Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1 Case No 14CF97 and No Contest to Counts 1 and 2 in Case 14CF122.  Court finds factual basis and pleas were made FV&K.  State heard.   Atty. Mayer heard.  Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  Court heard and accepts pleas and sentence is imposed:

14CF97:
$100 plus costs

14CF122:
Withheld 
2 years probation

Count 1 only:
DNA Sample
Costs
Shall receive 93 days credit should supervision be revoked

Count 2 only:
14 days DCJ w/H&T commencing forthwith
Alcohol Court 
$1820 (F+C)
27 mos. license revocation and IID 
VIP
AODA
  Probation review hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

8:16.  (14cf97/122) Defendant, Glen S. Stanford, in court, in custody with attorney William A Mayer.   Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mayer enters NG pleas and ask that matter track with 14cf122; reading waived.  Court waives reading; enters NG pleas, will track matters, matter to be set for motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Order on Arraignment

Defendant Glen S. Stanford in court, in custody with attorney William A Mayer.  Kurt F Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:45 am.

12:47 - Defendant Glen S. Stanford in court, in custody with attorney Stephanie R Strickland (eligible).  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1,000 Cash bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
